title: `Map::find` should not index, but call `get` instead to prevent ICEs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
`rustc_middle::hir::map::Map::find` will panic even though it's meant to return `None`, since it uses indexing instead of `get`. This was ran into while writing a clippy lint. This visited every `HirId` using `visit_id`. It would be expected that if it failed to find it, it would ignore that id. Instead, it panics. For now, a reimplementation has been created. ### Code https://github.com/Centri3/rust-clippy/blob/676ad8d65cfc5c9c383c7dcde30026ad7152cf88/clippy_lints/src/min_ident_chars.rs#L85-L87, not really applicable.
Backtrace
